Deadline Mundur, Jokowi Dinilai Tak Serius Ungkap Kasus Novel Baswedan
02 Nov 2019, 08:11 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Keputusan Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) menunda tenggat waktu pengungkapan kasus penyiraman air keras terhadap Novel Baswedan dipertanyakan. Jokowi dinilai tidak serius untuk mengungkap kasus yang menimpa penyidik KPK tersebut.
"Dari awal presiden memang tidak serius dalam mengungkap teror yang menimpa pegiat antikorupsi, salah satunya Novel Baswedan. Selain Novel, masih ada upaya pengeboman rumah pimpinan KPK, itu juga tidak jelas kasusnya. Memang sekarang bukan persoalan bisa tidak bisa, tapi mau tidak mau mengungkap teror ini," ujar peneliti Indonesia Corruption Watch (ICW) Kurnia Ramadhana kepada wartawan, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
ICW mengaku tidak paham alasan Jokowi menunda deadline kasus Novel. Mestinya, Jokowi dianggap perlu mengevaluasi kinerja Polri selama tenggat waktu awal yang ia tentukan, yakni 3 bulan.
"Kita juga tidak paham apa yang menjadi landasan presiden untuk kembali menunda teror ini. Harusnya ada evaluasi pada saat tenggat waktu habis 31 Oktober, apa respons presiden. Harusnya presiden menanyakan kepada Polri apa kendalanya dan apa temuannya. Kalau poin kami, Polri harus bisa mengungkap 3 setidaknya: Pertama, siapa 2 orang yang menyiram mata Novel Baswedan pada 11 April 2017? Kedua, apa motifnya? Ketiga, siapa aktor intelektualnya?" kata Kurnia.
"Kalau ketiga itu tidak diungkap Polri dalam waktu dekat, harusnya presiden memberikan punishment kepada aktor yang tergabung pada tim teknis Polri dalam mengungkap kasus Novel Bawedan. Kalau tidak jelas evaluasinya, maka presiden membiarkan teror ini menguap begitu saja dan itu tidak baik bagi komitmen negara memberantas korupsi," lanjutnya.

Deadline Retreat, Jokowi Not Serious Judged Revealed Baswedan Novel Case
02 Nov 2019, 08:11 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - The decision of President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) to delay the deadline for disclosing cases of hard watering on the Baswedan Novel is questioned. Jokowi was considered not serious in uncovering the case that had befallen the KPK investigator.
"From the beginning the president was not serious in exposing the terror that befell anti-corruption activists, one of them was the Baswedan Novel. In addition to the Novel, there are still attempts at bombing the house of the KPK leadership, it is also unclear the case. this terror, "Indonesian Corruption Watch (ICW) researcher Kurnia Ramadhana told reporters on Saturday (11/2/2019).
ICW claimed not to understand the reason for Jokowi delaying the Novel case deadline. Supposedly, Jokowi was deemed necessary to evaluate the performance of the National Police during the initial deadline he had set, which was 3 months.
"We also do not understand what is the president's foundation to re-postpone this terror. There should be an evaluation when the deadline ends October 31, what is the president's response. The president should ask the National Police what the obstacles are and what the findings are. If it is our point, the National Police must be able to reveal 3 at least: First, who are the 2 people who watered the eyes of the Baswedan Novel on April 11, 2017? Second, what was the motive? Third, who were the intellectual actors? " said Kurnia.
"If the police are not revealed in the near future, the president should give punishment to actors who are members of the Polri technical team in uncovering the Bawedan Novel case. If the evaluation is not clear, then the president will let this terror evaporate and that is not good for the country's commitment to eradicate. corruption, "he continued.
